Package org.forgerock.openam.sts.rest

Interface RestSTS

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IssuedTokenCancelOperation, IssuedTokenValidateOperation, TokenTranslateOperation
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RestSTSImpl
    public interface RestSTS
extends TokenTranslateOperation, IssuedTokenValidateOperation, IssuedTokenCancelOperation
    This is the top-level interface invoked directly by the REST-STS resource. Each of the methods defined in this interface will correlate to the top-level operations defined in the REST-STS.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      org.forgerock.json.JsonValue cancelToken​(RestSTSTokenCancellationInvocationState invocationState)
      Note that in the 13 release, token cancellation involves invoking the STS TokenService to remove the specified token from the CTS, which prevents subsequent successful validation.
      org.forgerock.json.JsonValue translateToken​(RestSTSTokenTranslationInvocationState invocationState, org.forgerock.services.context.Context context)  
      org.forgerock.json.JsonValue validateToken​(RestSTSTokenValidationInvocationState invocationState)
      Note that in the 13 release, token validation involves only consulting the STS TokenService to determine whether the specified token is currently stored in the CTS, thus implying that it was issued by the STS, and not yet expired, nor explicitly cancelled.

    • Method Detail

      • translateToken

        org.forgerock.json.JsonValue translateToken​(RestSTSTokenTranslationInvocationState invocationState,
                                            org.forgerock.services.context.Context context)
                                     throws TokenMarshalException,
                                            TokenValidationException,
                                            TokenCreationException
        Specified by:
        translateToken in interface TokenTranslateOperation
        Parameters:
        invocationState - An object encapsulating the input and output token state specifications
        context - The Context
        Returns:
        A JsonValue with a 'issued_token' key and the value corresponding to the issued token
        Throws:
        TokenValidationException - if the input token could not be validated
        TokenCreationException - if the desired token could not be produced
        TokenMarshalException - if the invocation state was invalid

      • validateToken

        org.forgerock.json.JsonValue validateToken​(RestSTSTokenValidationInvocationState invocationState)
                                    throws TokenMarshalException,
                                           TokenValidationException
        Description copied from interface: IssuedTokenValidateOperation
        Note that in the 13 release, token validation involves only consulting the STS TokenService to determine whether the specified token is currently stored in the CTS, thus implying that it was issued by the STS, and not yet expired, nor explicitly cancelled.
        Specified by:
        validateToken in interface IssuedTokenValidateOperation
        Parameters:
        invocationState - An object encapsulating the to-be-validated token state
        Returns:
        A JsonValue with a 'token_valid' key with a value of either true or false
        Throws:
        TokenValidationException - if the input token could not be validated
        TokenMarshalException - if the invocation state was invalid

      • cancelToken

        org.forgerock.json.JsonValue cancelToken​(RestSTSTokenCancellationInvocationState invocationState)
                                  throws TokenMarshalException,
                                         TokenCancellationException
        Description copied from interface: IssuedTokenCancelOperation
        Note that in the 13 release, token cancellation involves invoking the STS TokenService to remove the specified token from the CTS, which prevents subsequent successful validation.
        Specified by:
        cancelToken in interface IssuedTokenCancelOperation
        Parameters:
        invocationState - The invocationState, as generated by the caller, containing the to-be-cancelled token state
        Returns:
        a JsonValue indicating operation success
        Throws:
        TokenMarshalException - if the token state corresponding to the to-be-validated token was incorrect
        TokenCancellationException - if an exception occurred which prevented token cancellation from occurring
